detaileddescription.para: Returned by dns_lookup_host_async() if the result is immediately available in the ip parameter, and the ip parameter was non-NULL.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* dns_reply_callback_a) (uint32_t result, const char *hostname, uint16_t reply_id)
memberdef.name: dns_reply_callback_a

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* dns_reply_callback_aaaa) (uint8_t *result, const char *hostname, uint16_t reply_id)
memberdef.name: dns_reply_callback_aaaa

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* dns_reply_callback_ptr) (const char *const result, const uint32_t ip, uint16_t reply_id)
memberdef.argsstring: )(const char *const result, const uint32_t ip, uint16_t reply_id)
memberdef.name: dns_reply_callback_ptr

detaileddescription.para: Represents a dns request/reply header, and its payload as opaque data.
Format of an ARP packet (per RFC 826)
Generic ACPI System Description Table Header.

This structure serves as the entry point to the ACPI system description tables. Its location is typically found by scanning the BIOS memory range. It may point to either the RSDT (ACPI 1.0) or XSDT (ACPI 2.0+).
All ACPI tables begin with this header. It is used to identify table type, length, version, and source information.
Points to other system description tables using 32-bit addresses. Superseded by XSDT in ACPI 2.0+ which uses 64-bit addresses.

briefdescription.para: Look up an IPV4 hostname to IP address, with timeout.

simplesect.para: This function is synchronous! It will block until a suitable DNS request has been obtained from the DNS server you specify, or a timeout is reached.

parameterdescription.para: The IP of the resolver to use, in network byte order

simplesect.para: uint32_t Resolved IP address. On error or timeout, the return value is 0, which translates to 0.0.0.0.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint32_t resolver_ip, const char *hostname, uint32_t *ip, dns_reply_callback_a callback)
memberdef.name: dns_lookup_host_async

briefdescription.para: Look up an IPV4 hostname to IP address, with timeout.

simplesect.para: This function is asynchronous. It will return the ID of the request, and will call the callback once the request has completed.

parameterdescription.para: The IP of the resolver to use, in network byte order
Pointer to uint32_t IP address to immediately return if the result is cached
Callback to receive the resolved IP address. If an error occured during resolution, the received IP address will be 0, which is a representation of 0.0.0.0.

simplesect.para: uint16_t Request ID that was submitted, or 0 on error. a special value DNS_RESULT_CACHED (0xffffffff) is returned if the result was immediately filled from the DNS cache.

briefdescription.para: Initialise DNS protocol. This binds a UDP port for use with replies.
